title: Verify DEV10 Environment Configuration
custom_steps:
1. Open a web browser.
2. Navigate to [https://ph31mldvapppvn10.back.tickets.com:18443/springapp/homePage](https://ph31mldvapppvn10.back.tickets.com:18443/springapp/homePage).
3. Verify that the page loads properly and the DEV10 environment is accessible.
custom_expected: The DEV10 environment should be configured properly and accessible.

title: Verify New Patron Creation
custom_preconds:
Navigate to https://ph31mldvapppvn10.back.tickets.com:18443/springapp/homePage.
The DEV10 environment is accessible.
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the ticketing page â†’ Patron Administration.
2. Locate the button labeled "NEW" and click on it.
3. Verify that a new form is displayed with input fields for username, first and last name, address, and email.
4. Fill in the necessary information in the required fields.
5. Click the "Apply Changes" button.
custom_expected:
The form should be displayed correctly.
The entered information should be saved successfully.
A new record should be created in the Patron database.

title: Record New Account ID
custom_preconds:
Navigate to https://ph31mldvapppvn10.back.tickets.com:18443/springapp/homePage.
A new patron has been successfully created.
custom_steps: Once the changes have been successfully applied, record the new Account ID that is generated for the created Patron.
custom_expected: The new Account ID should be recorded correctly.

title: Verify pv.testqueue on Rabbitmq UI
custom_preconds: Navigate to the rabbitmq UI at https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.testqueue.
custom_steps:
1. Open a web browser.
2. Navigate to the rabbitmq UI at [https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.testqueue](https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.testqueue).
3. Explore the available queues.
4. Verify that the "pv.testqueue" queue is present.
custom_expected: The "pv.testqueue" queue should be present on the rabbitmq UI.

title: Retrieve Messages from pv.testqueue
custom_preconds: The "pv.testqueue" queue is present on the rabbitmq UI.
custom_steps:
1. On the rabbitmq UI, locate the "Get Messages" button or menu item.
2. Click the "Get Messages" button or menu item.
custom_expected: A message representing the created Patron Account ID should be displayed.

title: Verify that a new patron is created successfully via API call
custom_steps: API request to create a new patron
custom_expected: The API call is successful and returns a response indicating that the patron is created.

title: Verify that the response body of the API call contains the new Patron ID
custom_steps: API request to create a new patron
custom_expected:
The API call is successful and the response body contains the new Patron ID.

title: Verify that the Patron ID is populated in the RabbitMQ UI
custom_preconds: Open the RabbitMQ UI using the provided URL: https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.testqueue
custom_steps: API request to create a new patron
custom_expected: The RabbitMQ UI shows a new message in the "pv.testqueue" queue and the message contains the Patron ID.

title: Verify that the Patron ID displayed in the RabbitMQ UI matches the Patron ID returned in the API response
custom_preconds: Open the RabbitMQ UI using the provided URL: https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.testqueue
custom_steps: API request to create a new patron
custom_expected: The Patron ID displayed in the RabbitMQ UI matches the Patron ID returned in the API response.

title: Verify that the Patron ID displayed in the RabbitMQ UI is unique for each new patron created
custom_preconds: Open the RabbitMQ UI using the provided URL: https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.testqueue
custom_steps: Multiple API requests to create new patrons
custom_expected: Each new patron created has a unique Patron ID displayed in the RabbitMQ UI.

title: RabbitMQ Message Generation Testing
custom_preconds:
** Scenario: Verify RabbitMQ message generation functions correctly

Given User is on the RabbitMQ messages page https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.test
custom_steps: When User conducts the regression tests
custom_expected:
Then the messages before and after the changes should be identical

And there should be no additional fields or characters in the messages

And there should be no missing or altered information in the messages

title: Validate creators that utilize the same Transaction as MarketOfferReversal and publish to RabbitMQ
custom_preconds: Given user is on the RabbitMQ messages page https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pvhc.ticketscan.queue
custom_steps: When User navigate to the creators that utilize the same Transaction as MarketOfferReversal and publish to RabbitMQ
custom_expected:
Then the EventSalesDetailMsgCreator should be validated

And the TicketActionMsgCreator should be validated

And the MarketOfferFeedTransactionMsgCreator (Legacy API) should be validated

title: Test Environment Setup by Login to PV and Navigate to System Setup/System Administration/Application Properties
custom_preconds:
** Scenario: Test environment setup by logging into PV and navigating to the application properties page.
Given User is on the PV Login page https://ph31mldvapppvn10.back.tickets.com:18443/springapp/homePage

User provides valid credentials and clicks on the login button

User is successfully logged in to PV

User is logged in to PV
custom_steps: When User navigates to the System Setup/System Administration/Application Properties page
custom_expected: Then The application properties page is displayed

title: Set all the required properties to true
custom_preconds:
** Scenario: Set all the required properties mentioned below to true
Given User is on the application properties page
custom_steps:
When User selects the property "domain.event.publishing.enabled" and sets it to true

And User selects the property "domain.event.market.offer.v1.publishing.enabled" and sets it to true

And User selects the property "dataservice.gcp.pubsub.enabled" and sets it to true

And User selects the property "databus.domain.event.send.messages" and sets it to true

And User selects the property "multichannel.marketplace.feature.enabled" and sets it to true

And User selects the property "multichannel.marketplace.setup.enabled" and sets it to true

And User selects the property "dataservice.persist.messages.to.oltp" and sets it to true
custom_expected:
Then All the required properties are set to true

when user runs the purchase flow either through the API or UI the purchase flow should work as expected and the expected messages should be generated in the pubsub and RabbitMQ.

title: Change the properties to false
custom_preconds:
** Scenario: Observe the behavior after changing the properties to false

Given User is on the application properties page
custom_steps:
When User selects the property "domain.event.publishing.enabled" and sets it to false

And User selects the property "domain.event.market.offer.v1.publishing.enabled" and sets it to false

And User selects the property "dataservice.gcp.pubsub.enabled" and sets it to false

And User selects the property "databus.domain.event.send.messages" and sets it to false

And User selects the property "multichannel.marketplace.feature.enabled" and sets it to false

And User selects the property "multichannel.marketplace.setup.enabled" and sets it to false

And User selects the property "dataservice.persist.messages.to.oltp" and sets it to false
custom_expected:
Then All the properties are set to false

Expected: when user runs the purchase either through the API or UI the purchase flow should not work as expected and the expected messages should not be generated in the pubsub and RabbitMQ.

title: Verify PV is properly configured to send messages to Pub/Sub
custom_preconds:
Scenario: PV is properly configured to send messages to Pub/Sub
When User have a PV properly configured
custom_steps: When User try to send a message to Pub/Sub
custom_expected: Then the message should be sent successfully

title: Manual Market Reversals Testing
custom_preconds:
Scenario: Perform market reversal using Ticket Services UI
Given User is on the home page of Ticket Services https://ph31mldvapppvn10.back.tickets.com:18443/springapp/homePage
And log in with the TDC CM User ID
custom_steps:
Then click on the Ticketing tab

And select Ticket Services

And choose the "Transaction ID" option in the order search

And enter the desire value in the search value field

And click the Find button

And complete the fan purchase flow

And extract one of the following: Transaction ID, Order Id, Delivery ID, etc.

And expand the ticket details

And click on the sale type

And select "Market Reversal" from the Select Action drop down

And click Continue

And fill out the desired fields

And click Apply

Then the market reversal is performed successfully

Scenario: Verify reversal messages in Pub/Sub

Given on the Pub/Sub subscription details page

And enable the "Ack Message" checkbox

When click on the pull message to retrieve the newly generated messages
custom_expected:
Then User should see the reversal messages in the pubsub messages

And the pubsub messages should contain the expected attributes

And the JSON message should have the correct fields

title: Vesta Processing Testing
custom_preconds: **Given PV and Vesta QA teams are collaborating
custom_steps: When the domain event MarketOfferReversal message is sent to Pub/Sub
custom_expected:
Then the message should be created accurately
And the message should be stored in the DATA_BUS_MESSAGE table with the correct content and attributes

title: RabbitMQ Message Generation Testing
custom_preconds:
** Scenario: Verify RabbitMQ message generation functions correctly

Given User is on the RabbitMQ messages page https://rmqdev.back.tickets.com/#/queues/%2F/pv.test
custom_steps: When User conducts the regression tests
custom_expected:
Then the messages before and after the changes should be identical

And there should be no additional fields or characters in the messages

And there should be no missing or altered information in the messages
